IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OPERATING THE ROBIN RUN VILLAGE SENIOR LIVING COMMUNITY LOCATED AT 5354 WEST 62ND STREET, INDIANAPOLIS, INDIANA 46268 (THE COMMUNITY) WHICH PROVIDES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER WITH A CONTINUUM OF CARE INCLUDING INDEPENDENT LIVING, ASSISTED LIVING, MEMORY CARE, AND SKILLED NURSING CARE. THE COMMUNITY HAS 228 GARDEN HOMES AND 186 APARTMENTS DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY FOR OLDER ADULTS, AN 84-BED LICENSED SKILLED NURSING FACILITY, AND A 68 UNIT ASSISTED LIVING AND MEMORY CARE FACILITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: INDIANAPOLIS SENIOR CARE, LLC (DBA ROBIN RUN VILLAGE) OPERATES A CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY PROVIDING A CONTINUUM OF CARE INCLUDING INDEPENDENT LIVING, ASSISTED LIVING, MEMORY CARE, AND SKILLED NURSING FACILITIES. ROBIN RUN VILLAGE PROVIDES ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS THAT PROMOTE THE PHYSICAL HEALTH, EMOTIONAL HEALTH, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, WELLNESS, AND SOCIAL WELL-BEING OF THE INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, COMMUNITIES, AND POPULATIONS SERVED.
IRS990.Desc: ROBIN RUN VILLAGE IS A CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY CONSISTING OF 186 INDEPENDENT LIVING APARTMENT UNITS, 146 INDEPENDENT LIVING GARDEN HOMES, 94 LICENSED ASSISTED LIVING AND MEMORY CARE BEDS (CURRENTLY OPERATING IN 70 UNITS), AN 84-BED LICENSED SKILLED NURSING FACILITY THAT IS CURRENTLY OPERATING AS A 54-BED FACILITY. THERE ARE ADDITIONAL 82 GARDEN HOMES ON THE CAMPUS OWNED OUTRIGHT BY THE RESIDENTS. THE GARDEN HOME RESIDENT HOMEOWNERS PAY MONTHLY FEES FOR LIMITED SERVICES AND HAVE ELIGIBILITY FOR PREFERENTIAL ADMITTANCE TO THE SKILLED NURSING FACILITY. UNDER THE CONTINUING CARE CONCEPT, RESIDENTS ENTER INTO AN OCCUPANCY AGREEMENT, WHICH REQUIRES PAYMENT OF A ONE-TIME ENTRANCE FEE AND A MONTHLY SERVICE FEE. THESE PAYMENTS ENTITLE RESIDENTS TO THE USE AND PRIVILEGES OF THE COMMUNITY FOR LIFE, INCLUDING CERTAIN DISCOUNTED PRICING FOR ASSISTED LIVING OR SKILLED NURSING SERVICES THE OCCUPANCY AGREEMENT DOES NOT ENTITLE THE RESIDENTS TO AN INTEREST IN THE REAL ESTATE OR ANY PROPERTY OF THE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A TRUSTEE FOR RESIDENT FUNDS WHICH ARE EXPENDED ON BEHALF OF RESIDENTS. THE AMOUNT OF RESIDENT FUNDS HELD AT DECEMBER 31, 2022 HAS BEEN REPORTED ON PART X, LINE 21.

THE ORGANIZATION (ROBIN RUN) IS ORGANIZED AS A SINGLE MEMBER LLC IN WHICH BONCREST RESOURCE GROUP, INC, AN ENTITY THAT IS EXEMPT FROM TAXATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE IS THE SOLE MEMBER AND IS CONSIDERED A "DISREGARDED ENTITY" UNDER THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ORGANIZATION SEPARATELY RECEIVED A SECTION 501(C)(3) TAX EXEMPT DETERMINATION LETTER ON FEBRUARY 3, 2003. THE ACTIVITY OF ROBIN RUN IS REPORTED ON A CONSOLIDATED BASIS BY THE PARENT WHICH HAS BEEN GRANTED RECOGNITION OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ACCORDINGLY, INCOME EARNED IN FURTHERANCE OF ROBIN RUN'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. AS A RESULT, THESE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INCLUDE NO PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR INCOME TAXES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MANAGER HAS THE AUTHORITY TO ACT FOR THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BETWEEN REGULAR MEETINGS OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ENTERED INTO A MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH AN INDEPENDENT MANAGEMENT COMPANY. TOTAL MANAGEMENT FEES WERE APPROXIMATELY $1,055,000 AND $637,000 FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2022 AND THE PERIOD MAY 17, 2021 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2021, RESPECTIVELY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BUSINESS AFFAIRS OF THE COMPANY SHALL BE MANAGED BY THE GOVERNING BOARD APPOINTED BY THE ORGANZIATION'S SOLE MEMBER BONCREST. THE GOVERNING BOARD SHALL HAVE FULL AND COMPLETE AUTHORITY, POWER, AND DISCRETION TO MANAGE AND CONTROL THE BUSINESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND GENERAL COUNSEL MATERIALLY ENGAGES WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS IN RESPONDING TO ALL ITEMS COVERED IN THE FORM 990. WHEN ALL OF THE INFORMATION IS COMPILED INTO THE FORM 990 IT IS PRESENTED TO THE ENTIRE GOVERNING BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD WILL OVERSEE AN ANNUAL REVIEW OF EXECUTIVE PERFORMANCE BASED ON A REPORT FROM EACH EXECUTIVE REGARDING THE EXECUTIVE'S PROGRESS AGAINST GOALS. AS A PART OF THE REVIEW PROCESS, THE EXECUTIVE AND THE BOARD DISCUSS AND FORMALIZE GOALS FOR PERFORMANCE FOR THE NEXT YEAR. THESE GOALS ARE ROOTED IN ORGANIZATIONAL PERFORMANCE AGAINST STRATEGIC GOALS, AS WELL AS THE OVERALL LEADERSHIP OF THE EXECUTIVE. THE BONCREST RESOURCE GROUP COMPENSATION COMMITTEE WILL ANNUALLY REVIEW EACH EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT BASED ON COMPARABLE SALARY AND BENEFITS DATA, SUCH AS DATA AVAILABLE FROM SALARY AND BENEFIT SURVEYS, WRITTEN JOB OFFERS FOR POSITIONS AT SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS, AND REVIEWING INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM IRS FORM 990 FILINGS OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS IN AN EFFORT TO LEARN WHAT NONPROFIT EMPLOYERS WITH SIMILAR MISSIONS OF A SIMILAR BUDGET SIZE THAT ARE LOCATED IN THE SAME OR SIMILAR GEOGRAPHIC REGION PAY THEIR EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AND LEADERS. BASED ON THE REVIEW THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE WILL MAKE A RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL BOARD FOR COMPENSATION INCLUDING SALARY AND BENEFITS FOR ALL BONCREST RESOURCE GROUP EXECUTIVE OFFICERS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE SHALL MAINTAIN MINUTES OF THE MEETINGS AND DELIBERATIONS AND THE PROCESS USED TO CONDUCT THE REVIEW. BASED ON THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE'S RECOMMENDATION, THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS SHALL DELIBERATE AND APPROVE EACH EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT, SUBJECT TO RECUSALS FOR EXECUTIVES WITH CONFLICTS OF INTEREST DURING ALL DELIBERATIONS REGARDING THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS, AND THE PROCESS FOR SUCH APPROVAL SHALL BE DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MEETING MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY EACH BOARD MEMBER IS GIVEN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND THE CEO EXPLAINS THE POLICY IN DETAIL PRIOR TO THE BOARD MEMBER'S SIGNATURE. ALL VENDORS RECEIVE AND MUST SIGN A FORM DISCLOSING ANY RELATED PARTIES INVOLVED PRIOR TO DOING BUSINESS WITH THE ORGANIZATION. ANYONE WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS PROHIBITED FROM VOTING ON MATTERS RELATED TO THE CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO IS DETERMINED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE'S RESPONSIBILITIES SHALL INCLUDE (A) TO ESTABLISH THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO OF THE ORGANIZATION; (B) REVIEW THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO UTILIZING COMPARABILITY DATA AND ESTABLISH MERIT INCREASES, IF ANY, IN SALARY, INCENTIVE BONUS, ETC.; AND (C) APPROVE A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT WITH THE CEO AND ANY CONTRACT REVISIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THE MANAGING MEMBER. UPON REQUEST, COPIES ARE SHOWN, MAILED, FAXED OR EMAILED TO THE INQUIRER.
THE BOARD IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: RAYMORE SENIOR CARE LLC DBA FOXWOOD SPRINGS
